page.title: 02St.Nicholas Church Harpenden
page.content: The church stands on the village green of this busy commuter town. It was built in Norman times, and a few stones now remain. Harpenden has grown around the church which has been important in peoples' lives through the ages. People meet to worship there and for baptisms, weddings and funerals. Lay people often read lessons in well attended services. The church is flourishing and lively and members work to serve the community. Newcomers, the sick and elderly are visited by church representatives. 'Helping Hands' a voluntary group has grown from this and anyone can join. Six clubs, like Young Mothers and the Wednesday Club, are open to people of all religions which the church works with as part of the ecumenical movements.
